ngiemboon: Múɔshùm Samîɛ lɔ̌ɔn faʼa mbwó Cʉ̀apʉ̀a á mvfò Elîɛ.
en: The boy Samuel served the Lord in Eli’s presence.   In those days the word of the Lord was rare and prophetic visions were not widespread.  # 3:1 Ps 74:9; Ezk 7:26; Am 8:11–12

ngiemboon: Elîɛ laa tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ńnuŋe na yé jʉʼ, mbà menÿɔ́g mé zyě lésíŋ, à te gíŋe ńkuʼu légyá jʉʼ mboŋó wɔ́.
en: One day Eli, whose eyesight was failing,   was lying in his usual place.

ngiemboon: Lâm Ssé la nyé ńkÿó kÿǒ, Samîɛ piŋ ńnuŋe tsɛ̀ɛ ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, á ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼ gie kʉbé Ssé la tyé wó,
en: Before the lamp of God had gone out,   Samuel was lying down in the temple of the Lord, where the ark of God was located.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a tóŋo Samîɛ. Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn!»
en: Then the Lord called Samuel,   and he answered, “Here I am.”

ngiemboon: Ńkÿote ńgʉa lejʉ́ŋ Elîɛ ńgɔɔn ngie: «wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn!» Ɔ̀ toŋó wɔ́ɔn? Elîɛ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «N kaa gú tóŋo; piŋ nzèm ńgʉa ńnuŋe!» Á leen ńké ḿbiŋ nzèm ńgʉa ńnuŋe.
en: He ran to Eli and said, “Here I am; you called me.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gíŋe ńtóŋo Samîɛ na tsɔ́ lekwò. Samîɛ lu ssé, ńgʉa ńgyá Elîɛ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn! Ɔ̀ toŋó wɔ́ɔn!» Elîɛ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «N kaa gú tóŋo mbà míŋ wɔ̀ɔn; piŋ nzèm ńgʉa ńnuŋe!»
en: Once again the Lord called, “Samuel! ”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la nyé pɔ́ te zsě Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la nyé pɔ́ te shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńgɔɔn nò mbwó yé.
en: Now Samuel did not yet know the Lord, because the word of the Lord had not yet been revealed to him.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gíŋe ńtóŋo Samîɛ, á na mbɔ́ɔntè yétá. Á lu ssé ńgʉa ńgyá Elîɛ, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn! Ɔ̀ toŋó wɔ́ɔn!» Elîɛ leen ńké ńzsé ngie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ̌ kɔʼɔ́ páʼa ńtóŋo múɔ mbàŋa wa.
en: Once again, for the third time, the Lord called Samuel. He got up, went to Eli, and said, “Here I am; you called me.”

ngiemboon: Elîɛ gɔɔn mbwó Samîɛ ngie: «Gʉa ńnuŋe; à lɔɔn ńtóŋo gú, ɔ̀ gɔɔn ngie: Gɔɔn nò mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, mèŋ ngàŋafàʼ gù, n ne ńjúʼu.» Samîɛ leen ńké ńgíŋe ńgʉa ńnuŋe na jʉʼ yé.
en: He told Samuel, “Go and lie down. If he calls you, say, ‘Speak, Lord, for your servant is listening.’ ” So Samuel went and lay down in his place.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la tó ńtyé jʉʼó. Ńgíŋe ńtóŋ páʼ metsɔ́ mekwò ngie: Samîɛ! Samîɛ! Samîɛ tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Gɔɔn nò! Mèŋ ngàŋafàʼ gù, n ne ńjúʼu.
en: The Lord came, stood there, and called as before, “Samuel, Samuel! ”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a leen ńké ńgɔɔn né Samîɛ ngie: «N ge gÿo néŋ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀ na pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ. Epʉ̀a pie é ge láʼ júʼu yɛ̌ nò ge láʼ vege tɛʼ.
en: The Lord said to Samuel, “I am about to do something in Israel that will cause everyone who hears about it to shudder.  ,# 3:11 2Kg 21:12; Jr 19:3

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ na yɛ̌ lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ ŋwɛ́, n gÿo mmó ntsèm gie n da gɔɔn ngie n ge láʼ gÿo, ńtí ngẅɛ̀ ndá Elîɛ, léfóo nzyeté ńgʉa ńkúu nzsoté.
en: On that day I will carry out against Eli everything I said about his family, from beginning to end.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ shwoŋó yé ngie n ge ŋag ngẅɛ̀ ndá yé fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, ńtí mefʉa gẅie à ne ńzsé: penkʉ́ pé la gwág Ssé, á piŋ ńké te wɔ́b kag.
en: I told him that I am going to judge his family forever because of the iniquity he knows about: his sons are cursing God,   and he has not stopped them.  # 3:13 Dt 17:12; 21:18

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo n kʉa, ńtí ngẅɛ̀ ndá Elîɛ, atsɔ́ nò lévéle mefʉa ngẅɛ̀ ndá Elîɛ té láʼ gwɔ́ wó wɔ́, tà mbɔɔ lécʉa na shúm pwɔʼ kà pɔ́ shúm sie mé náa wɔ́ɔ.
en: Therefore, I have sworn to Eli’s family: The iniquity of Eli’s family will never be wiped out by either sacrifice or offering.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la nuŋe tà ńkú mbaʼámbaʼ, ńdeen ńké ńtsɔ́ʼ mencwò ndá Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Samîɛ la ne ḿbɔ́gɔ lélaʼte yɛ̌ njÿòon mbwó Elîɛ.
en: Samuel lay down until the morning; then he opened the doors of the Lord’s house. He was afraid to tell Eli the vision,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Elîɛ tóŋo Samîɛ, ngie: Míŋ wɔ̀ɔn Samîɛ! Á tsɔ́ʼ ngie: Wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn!»
en: but Eli called him and said, “Samuel, my son.”

ngiemboon: Elîɛ zɛ́te yé ngie: À ně ńgɔɔn né gù ngie kɔ́? Mèŋ sẅíŋte gú, te lÿoon wɔ́ɔn tsɔ́ nò. E Ssé ge néŋ ntʉ̀ ndòon na gù, páʼ ɔ̀ lɔɔn ńdÿoon wɔ́ɔn tsɔ́ nò, á na menò mie à ně ńgɔɔn né gú.
en: “What was the message he gave you? ” Eli asked. “Don’t hide it from me. May God punish you and do so severely if you hide anything from me that he told you.”

ngiemboon: Á cʉa púʼu Samîɛ pú shwóŋo yé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ; à la te lÿoon yé tsɔ́ nò wɔ́. Elîɛ gɔɔn ngie: «Yé zɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a; à gÿo mmó gie à ne ńkwoŋo!»
en: So Samuel told him everything and did not hide anything from him. Eli responded, “He is the Lord. Let him do what he thinks is good.”

ngiemboon: Samîɛ la ne ńgúʼu, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a ne ńgwɔ́ né yé. Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔ̌ɔn ńgɔɔn kɔ́ mbwó Samîɛ wɔ́ɔ, ńké ńgÿo pɔ́ yɛ̌.
en: Samuel grew.   The Lord was with him,  # 3:19 Gn 21:22; 28:15 and he fulfilled everything Samuel prophesied.  # 3:19 Lit he let none of his words fall to the ground,# 3:19 1Sm 9:6

ngiemboon: Á la cʉa púʼu, epʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ ntsèm, léfóo Ndaŋ, ńgʉa ńkúu Mbɛɛshÿeba, pú ńzsé ngie Samîɛ kuʼu nyìŋ gẅie mé la tsɔ́ʼ páʼ à ge gwɔ́ ntsẅìnkʉ̀ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: All Israel from Dan to Beer-sheba knew that Samuel was a confirmed prophet of the Lord.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la gíŋe ńkẅiʼi ne ńkẅɛɛ mvfò pʉ̀a á Shʉlo kẅɛ: ńgíŋe ńkẅiʼi ne ńgÿo Samîɛ cʉa na shwóŋè yé, ńzsé yé á Shʉlo.
en: The Lord continued to appear in Shiloh, because there he revealed himself to Samuel by his word.
